title: SpaceX acquires parachute supplier
summary: In a rare acquisition, SpaceX has purchased out of bankruptcy a company that provided components for Dragon spacecraft parachutes.

title: China is working on a design for a reusable air-launched orbital rocket
summary: A Chinese launch vehicle maker is working on designs for an air-launched rocket for sending small satellites to orbit.

title: Timeline Leading up to Maiden Ariane 6 Flight Announced
summary:
European Space Agency director general Josef Aschbacher has announced that Ariane 6 will be launched for the first time between 15 June and 31 July 2024. In addition to a specific timeframe for the rocket’s debut, Ariane 6 task force officials also outlined the timeline of expected milestones leading up to the flight. ESA had […]
The post Timeline Leading up to Maiden Ariane 6 Flight Announced appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: House Committee Clears Commercial Space Bill on Partisan, But Friendly, Vote
summary: The House Science, Space and Technology Committee approved the Commercial Space Act today on a strictly party-line basis, but the top Republican and top Democrat on the committee agreed to […]

title: House Science Committee Sends Commercial Space Bill To House
summary: The House Science Committee has voted on party lines to move forward with H.R. 6131, the Commercial Space Act of 2023.

title: House Science Committee advances commercial space bill
summary: The House Science Committee voted on party lines to send a commercial space bill to the full House, although with the possibility of modifications before a vote there.

title: Satellite imagery analysis firm launches free greenhouse gas tracker
summary: French satellite imagery analysis provider Kayrros launched a free version of its global methane tracking map Nov. 29 to help hold governments and businesses to account for their emissions.

title: China Releases Images Of Tiangong Space Station From Shenzhou 16
summary: China has released photos by the crew of Shenzhou 16, who captured unprecedented images as they departed the station, before returning to Earth.

title: Defense Innovation Unit solicits new round of proposals for space network project
summary: The Defense Innovation Unit issued a new solicitation for proposals from private companies for a project known as the Hybrid Space Architecture.

title: Firefly Conducts First Hot-Fire Test of Miranda Engine
summary: Firefly Aerospace successfully conducted the inaugural hot-fire test of its cutting-edge Miranda engine at the company's Texas test site. During the test Firefly hot-fired up to 65% power, with the aim to validate the engine's startup sequence, laying the foundation for future testing phases.
